alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 12:55AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Comanche, northwestern Garvin, southern Grady, northwestern Stephens and southwestern McClain Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1255 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Agawam to near Rush Springs to 7 miles east of Sterling to 11 miles west of Marlow. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chickasha, Purcell, Marlow, Lindsay, Rush Springs, Bray, Dibble, Sterling, Washington, Alex, Norge, Bradley, Agawam, Criner, Central High, Ninnekah, Acme, Payne, Cox City and Erin Springs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 94 and 99. Interstate 44 between mile markers 70 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
